channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: High-speed trains collide after one derails in southern Spain, killing at least 21
item.description: The crash happened in Spain's Andalusia province. Officials fear the death toll may rise.
item.content:encoded:
The crash happened in Spain's Andalusia province. Officials fear the death toll may rise.

(Image credit: Carlos Luján)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Fewer orphans globally, due to HIV medication provided by the U.S.
item.description: Until last year, the number of children orphaned because a parent died from AIDS, was plummeting. That's thanks to America's 20 year effort to get lifesaving HIV meds to millions in need. But last years upheaval in foreign aid funding is raising concern that more children will be at risk of losing a parent to the deadly virus.
item.content:encoded: Until last year, the number of children orphaned because a parent died from AIDS, was plummeting. That's thanks to America's 20 year effort to get lifesaving HIV meds to millions in need. But last years upheaval in foreign aid funding is raising concern that more children will be at risk of losing a parent to the deadly virus.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: Race to populate the border between India and China
item.description: India said it would help create hundreds of "vibrant villages" along its border with China. Three years later, residents wonder where they are.
item.content:encoded: India said it would help create hundreds of "vibrant villages" along its border with China. Three years later, residents wonder where they are.
item.dc:creator: Omkar Khandekar

item.title: In Los Angeles, Iranian-Americans march against government crackdown in Iran
item.description: Marchers gathered Sunday in downtown L.A. against the Iranian crackdown on the protests that have taken place over recent weeks.
item.content:encoded: Marchers gathered Sunday in downtown L.A. against the Iranian crackdown on the protests that have taken place over recent weeks.
item.dc:creator: Sarah McCammon

item.title: Fear and internet blackouts make communication difficult for Iranians
item.description: While fears of an imminent US operation in Iran have receded, tensions remain sky high as street protests continue and communication is difficult due to fear and internet blackouts.
item.content:encoded: While fears of an imminent US operation in Iran have receded, tensions remain sky high as street protests continue and communication is difficult due to fear and internet blackouts.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: United Nations leaders bemoan global turmoil as the General Assembly turns 80
item.description: On Saturday, the UNGA celebrated its 80th birthday in London. Speakers including U.N. Secretary-General António Guterres addressed global uncertainty during the second term of President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
On Saturday, the UNGA celebrated its 80th birthday in London. Speakers including U.N. Secretary-General António Guterres addressed global uncertainty during the second term of President Trump.

(Image credit: Toby Shepheard)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: European leaders warn Trump's Greenland tariffs threaten 'dangerous downward spiral'
item.description: In a joint statement, leaders of eight countries said they stand in "full solidarity" with Denmark and Greenland. Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen added: "Europe will not be blackmailed."
item.content:encoded:
In a joint statement, leaders of eight countries said they stand in "full solidarity" with Denmark and Greenland. Denmark's Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen added: "Europe will not be blackmailed."

(Image credit: Geert Vanden Wijngaert)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Syrian government announces a ceasefire with the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces
item.description: Syria's new leaders, since toppling Bashar Assad in December 2024, have struggled to assert their full authority over the war-torn country.
item.content:encoded:
Syria's new leaders, since toppling Bashar Assad in December 2024, have struggled to assert their full authority over the war-torn country.

(Image credit: Ghaith Alsayed)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Venezuela: Maduro's enforcer Cabello still central to power
item.description: The ousting of Venezuela's president raised hopes of change — but the politician now controlling the streets shows how little has really shifted.
item.content:encoded:
The ousting of Venezuela's president raised hopes of change — but the politician now controlling the streets shows how little has really shifted.

(Image credit: FEDERICO PARRA)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: US launches new retaliatory strike in Syria, killing leader tied to deadly Islamic State ambush
item.description: A third round of retaliatory strikes by the U.S. in Syria has resulted in the death of an Al-Qaeda-affiliated leader, said U.S. Central Command.
item.content:encoded:
A third round of retaliatory strikes by the U.S. in Syria has resulted in the death of an Al-Qaeda-affiliated leader, said U.S. Central Command.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
